I will be calling you back from an 847 number.
Must have FOID. All laws followed. Cops, you know the rules, please don’t BS me. Yes, it’s been attempted before.  The 3 days start when we come to terms, and you send me a pic of your FOID.
We can meet at a mutually agreed location, relatively close to Palatine. My home is fine. I will send you a pic of my FOID prior to meeting.
The 5 inch 1911 is this most accurate handgun I’ve ever fired. There are many reasons this model  is still popular after more than 100 years.
I’m open to trades, but would prefer cash. I would consider brand name ammo, .380, 9mm, .45, & .223. No steel, aluminum, or reloads. I’m not really looking for any additional firearms at this time. I will consider offers, but semi autos only, no revolvers.
If you are not familiar with the inner workings of a 1911, I will be happy to show you how to field strip & reassemble, at my home or at the range only. We must not frighten the villagers in public.
I am not a motivated seller.  I purchased this for nostalgic reasons. I carried a 1911 in the Army as an MP. I am the original owner.  I am not a collector, but this one basically sits in my safe. I just don’t fire it often, and it’s being ignored.
A few other gun buying tips in general for the newbies.
Calling something rare does not mean it has value. Discontinued models were discontinued for a reason. Usually nothing that would work in the seller’s favor. Do your research. 
So many here seem to have “never fired” guns for sale. Really? Or the “it didn’t fit in my or my wife’s hand well after firing only 3 shots”. Again, beware, use common sense.
Know the weapon before you purchase it. YouTube is a great resource. Don’t be afraid to disassemble it & inspect the inner workings to look for rust & excessive wear.
